item.title: Indo-European divine tripartation
item.description: Source: here. The following myths preserve a remarkable pattern of tripartation. In part they conform to Dumezil’s archetype of tripartation in the Indo-European world. brAhmaNas pa~nchavimsha brAhmaNa 18.9.1 Of varuNa, after he was consecrated, his fiery luster (bharga) departed. It fell asunder in 3 parts: 1/3rd became bhR^igu, the second 1/3rd became the shrAyantIya sAman, the final 1/3rd entered water. aitareya brAhmaNa 3.33-34 rudra shot his 3 pointed arrow and slew prajApati who was running towards his own daughter.
